results.title: The Game
results.creator_credit: Michael Carson, ABC-TV (Australia) and Michael Jenkins
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Scales of Justice Series”.
The Game is a story of jealousy and conflict, personal and professional. Detective Sergeant Draffin and Miles are both from the same mould. Both are ruthlessly ambitious, both boast a reputation of being first class operators, and both are very confident of their ability. However, neither is used to sharing the limelight, and when Draffin is transferred to the Drug Squad, Miles’ home territory, the scene is set for a major confrontation. Rated: M

results.title: The Game
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Educational Materials, Ken Peterson and Les Clark
results.brief_description: An animated film made for children, which poses the questions - how come some kids never play by the rules? Why do they always wan special treatment? Should the rules be changed? Various alternatives are offered for each problem but the real answers will be those which arise from group discussions.

results.title: The Game
results.creator_credit: Schonn-Pierre Hirst, Joshua Ash-Miller, Aden Porter and Laurence Gunther
results.brief_description:
The theme of belonging is explored by looking at rejection based on stereotypes in the schoolyard, and the effect that had on the victim. Also shown in this animated short is the impact an accepting group has on that person.

Under the category ‘Bullying. No Way! - Secondary”, Year 10, St John’s Grammar School, South Australia, were the Screen It 2012 winners.

results.title: The Game
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, John Kemeny and George Kaczender
results.brief_description: This is the boy-meets-girl game, but played without rules and at a time when the boy must prove himself in the chase. It is about the much-discussed sexual behavior of teenagers and shows that often the game starts with a challenge to his masculine ego from the boy’s peer group. Few adults are seen or heard from, nor does the film take sides in this game. A dramatisation.

results.title: The Game
results.creator_credit: SMS Audio Visual and Colin Pym
results.brief_description: Australian Rules football is uniquely Australian. Six champion players demonstrate the basic skills and techniques of the game. Includes scenes from the 1977 grand finals in Victoria, South Australia and Western Australia. Features VFL football players Barry Cable, Russel Ebert, Bill Gallagher, Peter Knights, Graham Moss, Kevin Sheedy.

results.title: The Gamblers
results.brief_description: Refers to bulldozing of earth banks, use of brakes, lowering of blades, adjustment of the machine while in operation, fraying of cables, starting, difficulties with children and so on when using earthmoving equipment. An excellent film for large contracting firms and for others using earthmoving plant.

results.title: The Gambler Dostoevsky
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Risk”.
A play based on Dostoevsky’s novel “The Gambler”. Dostoevsky lived his life on the edge of disaster, financial, political and emotional, and the story is about his gambling and about his loving. Dostoevsky’s widow, Anna, recalls her relationship with this complicated man.

results.title: The Gambler
results.creator_credit: Gambler Productions, Hungry Eye Lowland, Objektiv Filmstudio Vallalat, Charles Cohen, Marc Vlessing and Karoly Makk
results.brief_description: A British/Dutch/Hungarian co-production based on real-life events of Russian writer Fyodor Dostoyevsky and a dramatisation of his short novel, “The Gambler.” The film focuses on a period in the writer’s life at St Petersburg in 1866 when Dostoyevsky (Michael Gambon), aged 45, an obsessive roulette player whose consuming passion was forever landing him in debt, has an agreed deadline to complete a novel - or lose ownership of all his works to his rather unscrupulous publisher, Stellovsky (Thom Jansen). To help Dostoyevsky achieve this deadline, Anna (Jodhi May), an impoverished student desperate for money to help support her parents, is hired as his stenographer. But Anna finds to her dismay that this writer is not an easy person to work with. He is belligerent, cantankerous and condescending with no respect or sensitivity towards Anna’s feelings. However as the days go by, Anna finds herself inextricably caught up with Dostoyvesky’s imagination and the story he is creating - a tale of a young couple at the Casino in the fictional German resort Roulettenburg where the young man’s gambling obsession has put him into debt. The intertwining of reality and fiction eventually leads to a strange erotic attraction between Dostoyevsky and Anna. In real life, Anna Grigoryevna Snitkina became Dostoyvesky’s second wife and it is her written reminiscences that have allowed a glimpse into Dostoyevsky’s creative life and the eventual making of this film. Screenplay by Katharine Ogden, Charles Cohen and Nick Dear. Cast also includes Polly Walker, Dominic West, John Wood, Johan Leysen, Angeline Ball, Luise Rainer.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gambler Productions, Hungry Eye Lowland, Objektiv Filmstudio Vallalat, Charles Cohen, Marc Vlessing and Karoly Makk

results.title: The Gambia greets the Queen
results.brief_description: The West African tour of HM Queen Elizabeth II and HRH the Duke of Edinburgh in 1961. The welcome in the capital city of Bathurst, a meeting with the assembled chiefs of the Protectorate, and a journey by launch up the great Gambia River. A colorful impression of Gambia and its people.
